reviews.text: We stayed two nights in this hotel right after Christmas. At this time of the year NY is crowded and it is really tough to get decent deals. We got a rate of $104 a night, which can only be found in Newark or close to LaGuardia.
reviews.title: Good value in Manhattan
very clean and comfortable
reviews.text: The location was pretty good. Right in front of the Central Park. We stayed at the 10th floor and had an amazing view. From the balcony it was possible to see the NY's skyline. There are subway stations 3 block away (B-C) and if you walk 8 minutes west you can catch the 1 train.

The room itself was small and simple, even though we got an upgraded one. The carpet wasn't very clean but the linens were. The gap under the room door and balcony door were really big and wind blew thru it constantly making that "horror movie wind blowing" noise. The bed mattress was hard but fine to us, after walking all day long thru the snowy streets.
reviews.title: With a little more TLC, can be a real hidden gem hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was okay. The receptionist who first helped us was really helpful and polite. The others were okay. No complaints.
reviews.title: Great experience!

reviews.text: Overall, this was a good hotel considering location and price. For a similar hotel in Manhattan the minimum prices we could find was over $250/night in all major travel search websites.
reviews.title: Clean, no frills hotel, helpful staff

reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of this hotel. I had won it on Hotwire for slightly over $100/night and I was greeted with a clean room, king size bed, flat screen tv, an a view of the park. The subway is only a couple of minutes away, just walk south along the park. Parking is also free along the park and it is not that hard to get a spot, just watch the signs because they have street cleaning twice a week. Great little hotel, I would highly recommend it and would go back anytime! About 15 minutes to Midtown Manhattan, door to door.
reviews.title: Great hotel! My room was facing Central Park, 2 minutes from Subway, clean room, very modern!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Though room was small, it was very clean and nicely furnished. The hotel had a very euro feel. It was definitely nice to be across from Central Park. The staff was friendly and courteous. Would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: nice place

reviews.text: Totally average hotel, very well located near the subway. Concierge was nice. Rooms are small and not very clean. Front rooms have nice view of central park (though no overview).
reviews.title: Totally average hotel, very well located...

reviews.text: I've visited this hotel with my friend last week. It was our second time in NYC, but our first time in Astor on the Park. We were a little bit worried about the location, but when we arrived those worries were all gone ! It is a great location, across the street from Central Park and only 3 minutes away from the Subway. Even a taxi can bring you back to your hotel from almost every central location for about 10 $ till 15 $.
reviews.title: Great hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was small but enough to sleep in it. There was airconditioning in the room and was even left on the whole day and not shut down by the roommaid.
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After booking this hotel through a travel agent and knowing little about it i became rather scared as i couldn't find much about this hotel anywhere on the net apart from here and although everyone on this raved about the place, there was always something inside me being a little skeptical but all that changed when i arrived in NYC. If you are like me and your hotel room should consist no more than a comfy bed and a safe / clean enviroment for you and your belongings then this is the place for you. located between 106th and 107th street is is rather uptown but with the hotel located on Central Park West then the 40 odd minute walk is amazing and if you can't be bothered walking, 103rd Street station will take you to the heart of midtown in less than 10 mins. Neighborhood is great, everyone very friendly. Total bargain, highly recommend this hotel for anyone who uses a hotel as a hotel and not a living space.
reviews.title: PERFECT

reviews.text: This is a basic, no frills hotel situated opposite Central Park between 106th W and 107th W Street. (you need this precise address for the cab). It is some way from Times Square, but the pleasant and quiet neighbourhood ensured that we had a good night's sleep without the noise of traffic and wailing sirens all night long. We actually woke to the twittering of birds! The room was adequate, with two large beds (these would be 2 Double Beds in the UK) a small TV and a good size bathroom with a large bathtub and shower. The Air Conditioning is the typical American one, clamped to the window, and can be noisy if you need to keep it on all night. We could not get the shower nor the wall sockets to work, but this was soon put right with a demonstration by the very helpful and friendly staff of the hotel. Unfortunately there are no other amenities, not even a coffee machine, but the staff will send out for food etc. should you wish it. Otherwise there is a Deli only a few steps down the road if you can't wait for your first cup of coffee or breakfast until you get to a Diner nearer the Hub of the city. And, if you are someone who is into fitness, just jog across the road and join the Joggers in the Park!
reviews.title: Basic, No-frills, but a Good Night's Sleep!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights, leaving in the mornings and returning after dinner at night. A Taxi to Times Square will set you back $10, but the drive through the park each morning was, for me, an added bonus.
reviews.title: What a deal...

reviews.text: We certainly enjoyed this place after searching all over the upper West Side for something convenient and reasonably priced for what we were looking to do. Comfortable bed, extra blanket was nice since it was chilly, nicely stocked bathroom, helpful front desk staff. The reservation process was easy. We liked the brief walk to Amsterdam and Broadway and found convenient transportation. For the price, convenience, etc. I advise giving this place a try.
reviews.title: Great welcome

reviews.text: I would quite particularly like to thank the doorman who is so kind with children and adults. A very good hotel for a short stay. In front of Central Park, ilt's a bit difficult to take the subway on week end because the closest line is closed. You must walk to find an othe line.
reviews.title: Good safe palece to stay for senoir citizens

reviews.text: I'm from the south and demand to be treated as if I am the only customer you have and it was just that! We arrived at 1p and was able to check in immediatley, we even got to look and pick which room we wanted! The man at the door brought our luggage up immediatly. My friend and I wanted to hit the town, but we needed a little help getting to subway and a few other places. The employees at the Astor were more than happy to answer questions, tell you which way to go, and give you all the info you need. I must say I felt like I was at home with all the hopitality!
reviews.title: Cant wait to stay again!

reviews.text: The price is awesome$ for the fabulous room and the great sleep I got on the comfy mattres. If you are looking for luxury you find it here. This place is simple, clean and everyone is at your becon call. Having stayed near Times Square in the pricier hotels before this is absolutley the only place I will stay again. I felt like a real New Yorker!!
reviews.title: Basic but nice

reviews.text: The Subway is about 2 blocks away and $27. will buy you a pass good for 7days. This is the only way to travel In the Big Apple! The employees at the desk will give you a subway map and you will be able to go anywhere in the city you want.
reviews.title: GREAT SERVICE, GREAT PRICE

reviews.text: There is a little restaurant about 2 blocks away that have fresh pastry and the food prices are the same as you would find anywhere.
reviews.title: In NY you get what you pay for.... but this is value!

reviews.text: Thank you Astor Hotel for making my stay even more than expected!
reviews.title: Basic but clean and warm
